snippet: After the musical “Carrie” closed earlier than scheduled on Sunday, some theater bloggers and critics have wondered if it was salvageable in the first place.
abstract: Broadway musical Carrie, an $8 million flop in 1998, closes after 80 performances of its most recent $1.5 million revival, leaving some theater goers, bloggers and critics to wonder if it was worth the second chance, given the challenges the production faced from the beginning.
lead_paragraph: After the musical “Carrie” closed earlier than scheduled on Sunday, some theater bloggers and critics have wondered if it was salvageable in the first place.

headline.seo: What Happened to Off Broadway Revival of ‘Carrie’?
headline.main: ‘Carrie’ Revival, Now Dead, Has an Autopsy
headline.print_headline: ‘Carrie’ Revival, Now Dead, Has an Autopsy
